headline: 1 S&P 500 Stock for Long-Term Investors and 2 We Ignore
summary: The S&P 500 (^GSPC) is often seen as a benchmark for strong businesses, but that doesn’t mean every stock is worth owning. Some companies face significant challenges, whether it’s stagnating growth, heavy debt, or disruptive new competitors.

headline: Xylem (XYL) Margin Jump Reinforces Valuation Debate as Profit Tops 10%
summary: Xylem (XYL) posted net profit margins of 10.7%, up from 9.9% a year ago, and reported 14.2% earnings growth over the past year. This figure is below its five-year average of 26.5% per year. The company is forecasting earnings growth of 14.8% annually and revenue growth of 4.9% per year. Both projections are below the US market averages, which stand at 15.6% for earnings growth and 10.2% for revenue growth. With robust profit margins and steady, though slightly slower, earnings growth, the...
